intro: Tromotriche baylissii, commonly known as the Bayliss's tromotriche, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy yellow ray florets surrounded by tubular disk florets, typical of the daisy family. Tromotriche baylissii typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its foliage is usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, contributing to its distinctive botanical appearance.
